sentences.english: Ann: It’s said about 8 million yuan. I have never heard that any car made in China has such a high market price.
sentences.chinese: 據說是八百萬，我從沒聽過國產車有這樣高的市價。

sentences.english: It recently surpassed Microsoft Corp. in market value.
sentences.chinese: 最近蘋果的市價已經超過了微軟。

sentences.english: Diesel was selling for $25 a gallon on the black market after the quake.
sentences.chinese: 該地震後的柴油黑市價已經賣到了每加侖25美元。

sentences.english: Above market price for the door, if intends to buy the phone consulting.
sentences.chinese: 以上爲門市價，如有意向購買可電話諮詢。

sentences.english: Counteroffers unentertainable as market swinge other seller report withdraw.
sentences.chinese: 還價不可接受，因市價上漲，據說其他賣方已退出。

sentences.english: CORN…Corn futures closed higher and near session highs.
sentences.chinese: 玉米方面，玉米期價上漲，收市價接近當日交易高點。

sentences.english: Your counteroffer does not come in line with the current rate.
sentences.chinese: 你們的還盤與現行市價不符。

sentences.english: Your counter-offer is out of line with the current market, so we cannot accept it.
sentences.chinese: 你們的還盤與現行市價不符，所以我們無法接受。

sentences.english: By such reasoning the Coase result can be obtained without a market price.
sentences.chinese: 如此推理，高斯的效果可以沒有市價而達致。

sentences.english: Rarely transacting "at the market" and preferring to put price limits on their buy and sell orders.
sentences.chinese: 很少按市價交易，而更喜歡爲買賣委託單設置限價。

sentences.english: These should include a large number of rental units at below market rates that are available for people not originally from the locality.
sentences.chinese: 其中應包括以低於市價出租給非本地人的大量出租房。

sentences.english: Both Thomas and Paul thought that a rise in the market would enable them to cash in .
sentences.chinese: 托馬斯和保羅都認爲市價上漲可以使他們撈一把。

sentences.english: Because your count-offer is not in line with the present market level, we do not agree that.
sentences.chinese: 你方的還價與當前的市價不符，我方不予答應。

definition: to set a price/to fix a price
to quote a price/seller's first offer
property/real estate/abbr. for 物業管理|物业管理[wu4 ye4 guan3 li3], property management
to cut prices/to discount/to mark down/price cutting
to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
